intro: Iria salbundia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Iria salbundia thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows.
